name: Wireless Transmission Scoring
description: Scoring template for wireless transmission patents covering RF signal chain, modulation, NFC, amplifiers, and transceivers.
scoringGuidance: This sector covers the RF signal chain from antenna to baseband: amplifiers, mixers, filters, modulators, transceivers.
NFC (Near Field Communication) patents are included and represent a significant portion of high-value patents.
Look for innovations in power efficiency, linearity, noise figure, and integration.
contextDescription: Wireless transmission patents cover the physical and link layer signal processing in wireless devices. This includes RF front-end components (LNA, PA, mixers), modulation/demodulation, and increasingly NFC technology. Key differentiators are power efficiency, signal quality, and component integration.

questions.question: Where in the RF signal chain does this innovation apply? Consider: Antenna interface, RF front-end (LNA, PA, switch), frequency conversion (mixer, synthesizer), baseband processing, or end-to-end transceiver.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify the RF chain position. Score based on breadth of applicability: end-to-end (9-10), multiple stages (6-8), single component (3-5). State the specific components involved.

questions.question: How does this technology improve wireless spectrum utilization? Consider: modulation efficiency (bits/Hz), interference mitigation, bandwidth optimization, and spectral mask compliance.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe spectrum efficiency improvements. Score 1-2 if not applicable (e.g., pure NFC or power-focused patents).

questions.question: Does this patent improve power efficiency in transmission or reception? Consider: PA efficiency, low-power modes, power-aware modulation, or energy harvesting.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Describe power efficiency benefits. Score 1-2 if power is not addressed.

questions.question: How does this patent improve signal quality? Consider: noise figure reduction, linearity improvement, EVM optimization, interference cancellation, or receiver sensitivity.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Identify signal quality metrics improved and their significance.

questions.question: Is this patent related to NFC (Near Field Communication) technology? Consider: NFC protocols, NFC power harvesting, proximity detection, or NFC security.
questions.reasoningPrompt: Score 8-10 for core NFC innovation, 4-7 for NFC-applicable, 1-3 if not NFC related.
